Twitter thread on this subject where I touch on this topic: https://twitter.com/ercwl/status/963798714614800384‚Ä¶
What many don't seem to grasp is that the low throughput of the Bitcoin network is intentional. It's designed to give everyone a fair chance to fully validate all transactions on their home PC.
Eric Wall
@ercwl
 ¬∑ Feb 14, 2018
1/ The fundamental scalability limitations of cryptocurrencies is the CPU, bandwidth and memory load required in validating global transactions over a P2P network. Lesser constraints on block sizes (e.g. BCH, LTC, ETH) doesn't solve this problem. Neither to DAGs (IOTA).
